State: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
details: The Union Territory of Daman & Diu and Dadra & Nagar Haveli has successfully launched the “Swabhimaan Scheme” scheme to tackle the problems of Malnutrition, Anemia, and other relevant issues.
objective: Improve the nutritional status of pregnant women, lactating mothers, and adolescent girls
benefits: Under the scheme, the beneficiaries are provided a monthly quota of supplementary nutrition to pregnant women, lactating mothers, and adolescent girls on a fixed day of every month as a take-home ration.
The items provided in the supplementary nutrition kits are procured from the market through an open and transparent process.
Monthly supplementary nutrition provided to a beneficiary every month is as under:
eligibility: All the Pregnant Women, Lactating Mothers, and Adolescent Girls (Adolescent Category in the age group of 11-14 years) of the Union Territory of Daman & Diu and Dadra & Nagar Haveli are eligible to get the benefits of the scheme.
application_process: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the beneficiaries need to visit the nearest Anganwadis Centre or contact the office of the Social Welfare Department, Union Territory of Daman & Diu, and Dadra & Nagar Haveli.
The beneficiary may collect the enrollment form from Anganwadis Centre.
The beneficiary should fill out the enrollment form and attach the essential documents with the form.
After filling out the enrollment form, the beneficiary has to submit the form to the concerned persons in Anganwadis Centre.
After successful enrollment, the beneficiary may get the benefits of the scheme.
